exclusion:
1. Set the main Z-Wave controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual).
  2. Click o and - simultaneously.
  3. Click Δ or x until LED glows green.
  4. Click +.
  5. Wait for the removing process to end.
  6. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.
inclusion:
1. Set the main Z-Wave controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
  2. Power the device (insert the battery).
  3. Click any button three times.
  4. LED will pulse white during the adding process.
  5. Wait for the adding process to end.
  6. Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and green LED colour.
label: FGKF601
overview:
FIBARO KeyFob is a Z-Wave Plus compatible, battery-powered, compact remote control. Six buttons allow you to control other devices through the Z-Wave network and run various scenes defined in FIBARO System. Configure actions for one, two, three clicks, holding the button and button sequences to suit all your needs.

Built-in locking system will ensure that unauthorized person will not take control of your home.

Main features of FIBARO KeyFob:

  • Compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,
  • Supports Z-Wave network Security Mode with AES-128 encryption,
  • Battery powered,
  • Completely wireless,
  • Pocket size,
  • Equipped with 6 easily recognizable buttons,
  • 30 different actions, single/double/triple click, hold for each button and sequences,
  • Easy to operate menu,
  • Actions are confirmed by the built-in LED diode.

Basic activation

  1. Using included keyring or a coin, open the battery cover by turning it counter-clockwise
  2. Remove the sticker protecting the battery.
  3. Using included keyring or a coin, close the battery cover by turning it clockwise.
  4. Locate the device nearby the main Z-Wave controller.
  5. Set the main Z-Wave controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
  6. Click any button three times.
  7. LED will pulse white during the adding process.
  8. Wait for the device to be added into the system.
  9. Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and green LED colour.
usage:
Menu allows to perform Z-Wave network actions. In order to use the menu:

  1. Click o and - simultaneously.
  2. Click Δ or x until LED indicates desired menu position with colour:
    • White - wake up the device
    • Green - learning mode (adding/removing)
    • Cyan - check battery level
    • Yellow - reset the device*
  3. Click + to confirm selection, Click - to exit the menu.
  4. LED will pulse twice with same colour as selected menu position to confirm completing action.

Resetting the device to factory defaults:


Reset procedure allows to restore the device back to its factory settings, which means all information about the Z-Wave controller and
user configuration will be deleted. There are two ways of resetting the device:

Resetting the device using the menu:

  1. Click o and - simultaneously.
  2. Click Δ or x until LED glows yellow.
  3. Click +.

Emergency resetting the device on start-up:

  1. Remove the battery.
  2. Hold □ and + , while inserting the battery.

Successful resetting will be confirmed by smoothly brightening and dimming of the yellow LED colour.
wakeup: The KeyFob needs to be woken up to receive information about the new configuration from the Z-Wave controller, like parameters and associations. Use 1st menu position (white) or click o and + simultaneously to wake up the device.

category.label: Remote Control
category.description: Any portable or hand-held device that controls the status of something, e.g. remote control, keyfob etc.

channels.name: protection_local
channels.label: Enable Local Protection
channels.overview: To set PROTECTION Command Class to Local Protection by Sequence

parameters.label: Lock Mode - unlocking sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to activate Lock Mode and set up unlocking sequence. Device will lock after time set in parameter 2 or after pressing and holding selected button.

parameters.label: Lock Mode - time to lock and locking button
parameters.overview:
• This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last press of the button to lock the device and locking button.
  • Setting locking button will deactivate associations and scenes for pressing and holding the selected button.
  • This parameter is irrelevant if parameter 1 is set to 0 (Lock Mode disable).

parameters.label: First scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 7. See "Sequences" on page 10 for more information.

parameters.label: Second scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 8.

parameters.label: Third scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 9.

parameters.label: Fourth scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 10.

parameters.label: Fifth scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 11.

parameters.label: Sixth scene sequence
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set up sequence that activates scene with ID 12.

parameters.label: Sequences - timeout
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to set time that must elapse from the last click of the button to check if the sequence is valid.

parameters.label: Single button associations - operating mode
parameters.description: This parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations.
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to choose operating mode for single button associations.

options.label: single click switches state to opposite
single click => opposite, double click => max
single click turns on, double click turns off

parameters.label: Value sent to □ association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: Value sent to ○ association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: Value sent to x association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.overview:

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: Value sent to - association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set value sent to devices in association group. It will result in turning multilevel devices on with set or last level. Value is irrelevant for simple on/off devices.

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.overview:

parameters.label: Paired buttons association for □ and ○
parameters.description: activate paired buttons association mode for □ and ○ buttons
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for □ and ○ buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to □ groups. ○ turns devices on and increases value, □ turns them off and decreases value.

parameters.label: Paired buttons association for x and Δ
parameters.description: allows to activate paired buttons association mode for x and Δ buttons
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for x and Δ buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to x groups. Δ turns devices on and increases value, x turns them off and decreases value.

parameters.label: Paired buttons association for - and +
parameters.description: allows to activate paired buttons association mode for - and + buttons
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to activate paired buttons association mode for - and + buttons. Paired buttons are dependent and association are sent only to - groups. + turns devices on and increases value, - turns them off and decreases value.

parameters.label: Scene activation for □ button
parameters.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.

1 - Key pressed 1 time
2 - Key pressed 2 times
4 - Key pressed 3 times
8 - Key held down & released

Combine multiple actions by combining the values.

parameters.label: Scene activation for ○ button
parameters.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending assigned scene IDs and attributes to the controller.

1 - Key pressed 1 time
2 - Key pressed 2 times
4 - Key pressed 3 times
8 - Key held down & released

Combine multiple actions by combining the values.

parameters.description: 1 = 1 time, 2 = 2 times, 4 = 3 times, 8 = held down and released

parameters.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.description: defines how commands are sent in specified association groups
parameters.overview:
Parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: using Security Mode or not. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st “Lifeline” association group.

Available settings:

1 - 2nd group sent using Security Mode
2 - 3rd group sent using Security Mode
4 - 4th group sent using Security Mode
8 - 5th group sent using Security Mode
16 - 6th group sent using Security Mode
32 - 7th group sent using Security Mode
64 - 8th group sent using Security Mode
128 - 9th group sent using Security Mode
256 - 10th group sent using Security Mode
512 - 11th group sent using Security Mode
1024 - 12th group sent using Security Mode
2048 - 13th group sent using Security Mode

Set multiple values by combining the values together.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

associations.label: Square - On/Off
associations.description: “Square - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the □ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Square - Multilevel
associations.description: “Square - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the □ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

associations.label: Circle - On/Off
associations.description: “Circle - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the ○ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Circle - Multilevel
associations.description: “Circle - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the ○ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

associations.label: Cross - On/Off
associations.description: “Cross - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the x button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Cross - Multilevel
associations.description: “Cross - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the x button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

associations.label: Triangle - On/Off
associations.description: “Triangle - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the Δ button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Triangle - Multilevel
associations.description: “Triangle - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the Δ button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

associations.label: Minus - On/Off
associations.description: “Minus - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the - button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Minus - Multilevel
associations.description: “Minus - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the - button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.

associations.label: Plus - On/Off
associations.description: “Plus - On/Off” is assigned to clicking the + button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.

associations.label: Plus - Multilevel
associations.description: “Plus - Multilevel” is assigned to clicking and holding the + button and is used to turn on/off and change level of associated devices.
